text:
Hi, I am just unable to install the Atom package (and others) on a completely clean julia 1.5.3. It was working fine before.

$ julia --startup-file=no
julia> using Pkg; Pkg.activate("foo", shared=true) # empty project, no Manifest.toml
 Activating new environment at `~/.julia/environments/foo/Project.toml`

julia> Pkg.dependencies()
Dict{Base.UUID,Pkg.Types.PackageInfo}()

julia> Pkg.add("Atom")
   Updating registry at `~/.julia/registries/JuliaComputingRegistry`
   Updating registry at `~/.julia/registries/takbal`
   Updating git-repo `git@10.10.10.3:julia-registry.git`
  Resolving package versions...
ERROR: Unsatisfiable requirements detected for package Atom [c52e3926]:
 Atom [c52e3926] log:
 ├─Atom [c52e3926] has no known versions!
 └─restricted to versions * by an explicit requirement — no versions left

$ julia --startup-file=no
julia> using Pkg; Pkg.activate("foo", shared=true) # empty project, no Manifest.toml

julia> Pkg.dependencies()

julia> Pkg.add("Atom")

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>
solved by removing the General registry and re-adding it

elements.text: solved by removing the General registry and re-adding it
